word: Now, my brethren [G. I. Butler and Uriah Smith], I do not feel very happy, . . . be assured, when I think you have encouraged Elder Canright in giving lessons to the students in the College, and in pouring into the Review such a mass of matter as though he were bishop of the Methodist Church.--Letter 13, 1887, p. 2. (To Brethren Butler and Smith, April 5, 1887.)
